definition: to wish/to express good wishes/to pray/(old) wizard
to thank/to apologize/to wither (of flowers, leaves etc)/to decline

sentences.english: 23Then he took the cup, gave thanks and offered it to them, and they all drank from it.
sentences.chinese: 又拿起杯来，祝谢了递给他们，他们都喝了。

sentences.english: The minister invites the people to the Lord's table and then gives thanks to God.
sentences.chinese: 牧师邀请信徒同来到圣餐桌前，然后为圣餐祝谢。

sentences.english: Then he took the cup, gave thanks and offered it to them, saying, "Drink from it, all of you.
sentences.chinese: 又拿起杯来，祝谢了，递给他们，说，你们都喝这个。

sentences.english: I exhort therefore, that, first of all, supplications, prayers, intercessions, and giving of thanks, be made for all men;
sentences.chinese: 我劝你第一要为万人恳求祷告，代求，祝谢。

sentences.english: And he took the cup, and gave thanks, and gave it to them, saying, Drink ye all of it;
sentences.chinese: 又拿起杯来，祝谢了，递给他们，说，你们都喝这个。

sentences.english: Then he took the cup and again gave thanks.
sentences.chinese: 然后，祂拿起杯来，再次祝谢。

definition: First epistle of St Paul to the Corinthians
Jehovah (biblical name for God, Hebrew: YHWH)/compare Yahweh 雅威[Ya3 wei1] and God 上帝[Shang4 di4]
Hezekiah or Ezekias (740-687 BC), twelfth king of Judah (Judaism)
Epistle of St Paul to the Romans
